meanings.definition: Relating to or involving the formation of ideas.
meanings.sent1: Her ideative mind constantly generated new concepts.
meanings.sent2: The workshop encouraged ideative thinking among participants.
meanings.sent3: His ideative approach to problem-solving led to some interesting solutions.
meanings.sent4: In the garden of creativity, her mind bloomed with ideative flowers.
meanings.sent5: The artist's ideative process was as colorful as a rainbow.

meanings.definition: Capable of producing or forming ideas.
meanings.sent1: The students displayed their ideative skills in the project.
meanings.sent2: A curious mind is often an ideative one.
meanings.sent3: The ideative cat seemed to be pondering the mysteries of the universe.
meanings.sent4: Her imagination was an ideative powerhouse, constantly creating new worlds.
meanings.sent5: The ideative spark ignited a chain reaction of innovative thoughts.

meanings.definition: Characterized by the formation of ideas.
meanings.sent1: The ideative nature of the discussion sparked intellectual curiosity.
meanings.sent2: An ideative approach can lead to groundbreaking discoveries.
meanings.sent3: The ideative atmosphere in the room inspired deep contemplation.
